alert.note: Alert for Stone; Taney (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:50AM CST until December 20 at 2:45AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Christian, Douglas, Ozark, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 AM CST, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Bull Creek at Center Road, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Beaver Creek at County Road 524 and Pond Fork at County Road 883. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Branson, Ava, Kimberling City, Forsyth, Hollister, Silver Dollar City, Merriam Woods and Reeds Spring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
